intro: Melanthera urticifolia, commonly known as stinging nettle weed, is a herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves. The plant has a hairy stem and produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs that can cause skin irritation when touched. Melanthera urticifolia is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides.
